data.title: Metro Goldwyn Mayer Fanfare
data.text:
Program Notes

The Metro Goldwyn Mayer Fanfare was composed by Franz Waxman and first heard before the âMain Titleâ of Fritz Langâs Fury (1936); the first of seven Spencer Tracy films Waxman would score . It has introduced Metro Goldwyn Mayer films over the decades with the help of âLeo the Lionâ who can also be heard in the first contemporary recording; the opening of The Philadelphia Story Suite, which was recorded by Charles Gerhardt and the National Philharmonic on Sunset Boulevard: The Classic Film Scores by Franz Waxman (RCA/SONY).
